You are about to delete the account associated to {email}.

parameters.text:
1. Verify it
2. Log in on this page

parameters.format: A verification link was emailed to: {userEmail}

comments.text: We output the array 'providerData' from currentUser object
'currentUser' can be reused as id in an Object  node anywhere in the project to make its properties available
Creates the firebase instance and stores it in a Noodl Variable

HEAD PAGE SETUP
In your Project settings sidebar, Custom Code section, add the below Head Code:


















Firebase SDK version 9.0.0 is compatible with current setup, no version 9+.

<script type="module">
  import { initializeApp } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.0.0/firebase-app.js";
  import { getAuth, createUserWithEmailAndPassword, signInWithEmailAndPassword, onAuthStateChanged, sendEmailVerification, sendPasswordResetEmail, verifyBeforeUpdateEmail, updatePassword, EmailAuthProvider, reauthenticateWithCredential, signOut } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.0.0/firebase-auth.js";
  import { getFirestore } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.0.0/firebase-firestore.js";
  
  // Expose Firebase initialization and auth functions to the global scope
  window.initializeApp = initializeApp;
  window.getAuth = getAuth;
  window.createUserWithEmailAndPassword = createUserWithEmailAndPassword;
  window.signInWithEmailAndPassword = signInWithEmailAndPassword;
  window.onAuthStateChanged = onAuthStateChanged;
  window.sendEmailVerification = sendEmailVerification;
  window.sendPasswordResetEmail = sendPasswordResetEmail;
  window.verifyBeforeUpdateEmail = verifyBeforeUpdateEmail;
  window.updatePassword = updatePassword;
  window.EmailAuthProvider = EmailAuthProvider;
  window.reauthenticateWithCredential = reauthenticateWithCredential;
  window.getFirestore = getFirestore;
</script>
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/validator/validator.min.js"></script>
<script>
  window.validator = validator;
</script>
Set the localstorage keyName to save the AuthSession
Set the user profile table name

The sendPasswordResetEmail function does not provide a success response only when the user exists; it's designed to return a "success" response even if the email is not associated with any user, to prevent enumeration attacks where an attacker could use this function to discover valid email addresses. Firebase's behavior is to silently fail, meaning it does not disclose whether an email is linked to an existing account or not, for privacy and security reasons.

comments.text:
Recent firebase security upgrade enables the Email Enumeration feature by default.
Therefore use function verifyBeforeUpdateEmail instead of updateEmail

parameters.text: Update Email (may require re-authentication for security reasons)

settings.headCode:
<script type="module">
  import { initializeApp } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.0.0/firebase-app.js";
  import { getAuth, createUserWithEmailAndPassword, signInWithEmailAndPassword, onAuthStateChanged, sendEmailVerification, sendPasswordResetEmail, verifyBeforeUpdateEmail, updatePassword, EmailAuthProvider, reauthenticateWithCredential, signOut } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.0.0/firebase-auth.js";
  import { getFirestore } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.0.0/firebase-firestore.js";
  
  // Expose Firebase initialization and auth functions to the global scope
  window.initializeApp = initializeApp;
  window.getAuth = getAuth;
  window.createUserWithEmailAndPassword = createUserWithEmailAndPassword;
  window.signInWithEmailAndPassword = signInWithEmailAndPassword;
  window.onAuthStateChanged = onAuthStateChanged;
  window.sendEmailVerification = sendEmailVerification;
  window.sendPasswordResetEmail = sendPasswordResetEmail;
  window.verifyBeforeUpdateEmail = verifyBeforeUpdateEmail;
  window.updatePassword = updatePassword;
  window.EmailAuthProvider = EmailAuthProvider;
  window.reauthenticateWithCredential = reauthenticateWithCredential;
  window.getFirestore = getFirestore;
</script>
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/validator/validator.min.js"></script>
<script>
  window.validator = validator;
</script>
